item.title: QUERCETIN
item.description:
DrugBank ID: db04216
DrugCentral: quercetin
Synonymous :2-(3,4-dihydroxyphenyl)-3,5,7-trihydroxy-4h-1-benzopyran-4-one | 3,3’,4’,5,7-pentahydroxyflavone | 3,5,7,3’,4’-pentahydroxyflavone | sophoretin | xanthaurine


Drug Sentece Context


Table 1. Analysis of context sentence of quercetin gene in 1 abstracts.

pmid sentence
22842769 Quercetin (Qu) is found in plants, including red onions and in the skins of red apples, and induces the apoptosis of certain malignant cells.
27514524 Previously, we reported that Quercetin in combination with Cisplatin inhibits cell proliferation and activates caspase-9 and -3 enzymes in different malignant mesothelioma cell lines. […] Moreover, Quercetin + Cisplatin lead to accumulation of both SPC111 and SPC212 cell lines in S phase. […] Our results showed that Quercetin and Quercetin + Cisplatin modulated gene expression of cyclins, cyclin dependent kinases and cyclin dependent kinases inhibitors. […] Moreover, while p38 and JNK phosphorylations were increased, ERK phosphorylations were decreased after using Quercetin + Cisplatin. […] This research has clarified our previous results and detailed mechanism of anti-carcinogenic potential of Quercetin alone and incombination with Cisplatin on malignant mesothelioma cells.
